subject: Build Strength, Speed, and Endurance...
body:
Bicycling's Maintenance Repair Guide





















Dear Spie,
Inside this revised popular guide, you’ll find thousands of up-to-date tips to repair and maintain any road or mountain bike.
Whether you have the latest model or a classic that has thousands of miles on it, both beginning and experienced riders can keep their bikes on the road longer and spend less time in the repair shop. 
With this ultimate repair manual, you can:


Build a dream bike workshop of your own, using complete plans and comprehensive tool lists

Fix roadside and trailside breakdowns quickly and with a minimum of tools

Learn the principles of suspension tuning for top performance and comfort

Set up and maintain all styles of rim and disc brakes, including hydraulic models

Keep wheels spinning smooth and true

Choose a frame design that best fits your body and riding style

Discover top tricks from professional mechanics

What’s new in the expanded and revised fifth edition?










Updated text that covers the latest models and parts

More than 250 new photos so you get repairs right the first time

Clearer, better-designed captions so you can read as you repair

Troubleshooting sections to quickly identify and correct common problems

Web sites and phone  numbers for dozens of bicycle and parts manufacturers

An updated glossary with technical terms and jargon to help you understand and be understood







Best of all, you can give this amazing book a try— FREE for 21 days  with no obligation whatsoever! You pay nothing unless you’re totally satisfied. Click here!
Sincerely,

Chris Cunningham
Bicycling Magazine
